articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov, Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: A passenger on the Azerbaijan Airlines plane that crashed in Kazakhstan told Reuters that there was at least one loud bang as it approached its original destination of Grozny in southern Russia.
articles.title: Passenger on crashed plane says there was at least one loud bang before it went down

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Joyce Lee
articles.description: The impeachment of Han Duck-soo, acting president since Yoon was impeached on Dec. 14 for declaring martial law, has thrown South Korea's once-vibrant democratic success story into uncharted territory.
articles.title: South Korea's parliament impeaches acting president Han, as Yoon goes on trial

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli forces on Friday raided the Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of three medical facilities on the northern edge of the Gaza Strip, torching large sections and ordering dozens of patients and hundreds of others to leave, officials said.
articles.title: Israel raids north Gaza hospital, ministry says staff out of contact

articles.author: Essi Lehto, Anna Ringstrom
articles.description: NATO said on Friday it will boost its presence in the Baltic Sea after the suspected sabotage this week of an undersea power cable and four internet lines, while alliance member Estonia launched a naval operation to guard a parallel electricity link.
articles.title: NATO to boost Baltic Sea presence after power, internet cable damage

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A former engineer at a semiconductor manufacturer pleaded not guilty on Friday to U.S. charges that he illegally procured technology for an Iranian firm that made a key component of a drone used in a January attack by Iran-backed militants in Jordan that killed three U.S. service members.
articles.title: Engineer pleads not guilty in US case over deadly Iran-linked drone strike

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: Rifaat al-Assad, an uncle of the ousted Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad charged in Switzerland with war crimes over the bloody suppression of a revolt in 1982, has flown from Beirut to Dubai in recent days, two Lebanese security officials said on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Bashar al-Assad's uncle Rifaat flew from Beirut to Dubai, Lebanese officials say

articles.author: Ismail Shakil
articles.description: A Canadian parliamentary committee led by an opposition Conservative Party lawmaker will hold meetings during legislative recess in hopes of expediting the defeat of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's government, the lawmaker said on Friday
articles.title: Canadian lawmaker to start work on defeating Trudeau government in early January

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Felix Light
articles.description: The United States on Friday sanctioned Georgian billionaire Bidzina Ivanishvili, a former prime minister widely seen as the country's de facto leader, saying he was undermining democracy and allowing Russia to benefit.
articles.title: US imposes sanctions on Georgian ex-prime minister, billionaire Ivanishvili

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean troops deployed in Russia's Kursk region are suffering heavy losses and being left unprotected by the Russian forces they are fighting alongside, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy: North Koreans suffering battlefield losses, unprotected by Russian forces

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's arms control point man cautioned Donald Trump's incoming administration on Friday that Moscow was considering a whole range of possible steps on nuclear testing due to what it said was Trump's radical position on the issue.
articles.title: Russia warns the United States on possible nuclear testing under Trump
